1 Database

Trying out a connection to a database containing music information using RSQLite.

con <- RSQLite::dbConnect(drv    = SQLite(), 
                          dbname = "../../src/Chinook_Sqlite.sqlite") # Connect to db

print(dbListTables(con)) # Print list of available tables
#>  [1] "Album"         "Artist"        "Customer"      "Employee"     
#>  [5] "Genre"         "Invoice"       "InvoiceLine"   "MediaType"    
#>  [9] "Playlist"      "PlaylistTrack" "Track"
album_tbl <- tbl(con, "Album") %>% collect() # Retrieve "Album" table into local storage
print(album_tbl)
#> # A tibble: 347 x 3
#>    AlbumId Title                                 ArtistId
#>      <int> <chr>                                    <int>
#>  1       1 For Those About To Rock We Salute You        1
#>  2       2 Balls to the Wall                            2
#>  3       3 Restless and Wild                            2
#>  4       4 Let There Be Rock                            1
#>  5       5 Big Ones                                     3
#>  6       6 Jagged Little Pill                           4
#>  7       7 Facelift                                     5
#>  8       8 Warner 25 Anos                               6
#>  9       9 Plays Metallica By Four Cellos               7
#> 10      10 Audioslave                                   8
#> # i 337 more rows
dbDisconnect(con) # Disconnect db session

2 API

Trying out a connection to multiple APIs containing Star Wars information and Stock Prices with credentials.

# Wrapped into a function
sw_api <- function(path) {
  url <- modify_url(url = "https://swapi.dev", path = glue("/api{path}"))
  resp <- GET(url)
  stop_for_status(resp) # automatically throws an error if a request did not succeed
}

resp <- sw_api("/people/1") # Retrieve info about Luke Skywalker

content <- rawToChar(resp$content) %>% fromJSON() # Turn content into characters and convert json to list
print(content)
#> $name
#> [1] "Luke Skywalker"
#> 
#> $height
#> [1] "172"
#> 
#> $mass
#> [1] "77"
#> 
#> $hair_color
#> [1] "blond"
#> 
#> $skin_color
#> [1] "fair"
#> 
#> $eye_color
#> [1] "blue"
#> 
#> $birth_year
#> [1] "19BBY"
#> 
#> $gender
#> [1] "male"
#> 
#> $homeworld
#> [1] "https://swapi.dev/api/planets/1/"
#> 
#> $films
#> [1] "https://swapi.dev/api/films/1/" "https://swapi.dev/api/films/2/"
#> [3] "https://swapi.dev/api/films/3/" "https://swapi.dev/api/films/6/"
#> 
#> $species
#> list()
#> 
#> $vehicles
#> [1] "https://swapi.dev/api/vehicles/14/" "https://swapi.dev/api/vehicles/30/"
#> 
#> $starships
#> [1] "https://swapi.dev/api/starships/12/" "https://swapi.dev/api/starships/22/"
#> 
#> $created
#> [1] "2014-12-09T13:50:51.644000Z"
#> 
#> $edited
#> [1] "2014-12-20T21:17:56.891000Z"
#> 
#> $url
#> [1] "https://swapi.dev/api/people/1/"

Now I created a .Renviron file in the home folder and added the token in there. Now it can be accessed using Sys.getenv('token').

alphavantage_api_url <- "https://www.alphavantage.co/query"
ticker               <- "WDI.DE"
# You can pass all query parameters as a list to the query argument of GET()
WDIQuote = GET(alphavantage_api_url, query = list('function' = "GLOBAL_QUOTE",
                                       symbol     = ticker,
                                       apikey     = Sys.getenv('token'))
) %>% content()
print(WDIQuote)
#> $`Global Quote`
#> $`Global Quote`$`01. symbol`
#> [1] "WDI.DE"
#> 
#> $`Global Quote`$`02. open`
#> [1] "0.4021"
#> 
#> $`Global Quote`$`03. high`
#> [1] "0.4099"
#> 
#> $`Global Quote`$`04. low`
#> [1] "0.3961"
#> 
#> $`Global Quote`$`05. price`
#> [1] "0.3985"
#> 
#> $`Global Quote`$`06. volume`
#> [1] "210849"
#> 
#> $`Global Quote`$`07. latest trading day`
#> [1] "2021-03-01"
#> 
#> $`Global Quote`$`08. previous close`
#> [1] "0.4109"
#> 
#> $`Global Quote`$`09. change`
#> [1] "-0.0124"
#> 
#> $`Global Quote`$`10. change percent`
#> [1] "-3.0178%"

3 WEB SCRAPING

Trying out some webscraping examples from wikipedia and IMDB.

url <- "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_S%26P_500_companies"

sp_500 <- url %>%
  # read the HTML from the webpage
  read_html() %>%
  # Get the nodes with the id
  html_nodes(css = "#constituents") %>%
  # html_nodes(xpath = "//*[@id='constituents']"") %>% 
  # Extract the table and turn the list into a tibble
  html_table() %>% 
  .[[1]] %>% 
  as_tibble()
print(sp_500)
#> # A tibble: 503 x 8
#>    Symbol Security      `GICS Sector` `GICS Sub-Industry` Headquarters Locatio~1
#>    <chr>  <chr>         <chr>         <chr>               <chr>                 
#>  1 MMM    3M            Industrials   Industrial Conglom~ Saint Paul, Minnesota 
#>  2 AOS    A. O. Smith   Industrials   Building Products   Milwaukee, Wisconsin  
#>  3 ABT    Abbott        Health Care   Health Care Equipm~ North Chicago, Illino~
#>  4 ABBV   AbbVie        Health Care   Pharmaceuticals     North Chicago, Illino~
#>  5 ACN    Accenture     Information ~ IT Consulting & Ot~ Dublin, Ireland       
#>  6 ATVI   Activision B~ Communicatio~ Interactive Home E~ Santa Monica, Califor~
#>  7 ADM    ADM           Consumer Sta~ Agricultural Produ~ Chicago, Illinois     
#>  8 ADBE   Adobe Inc.    Information ~ Application Softwa~ San Jose, California  
#>  9 ADP    ADP           Industrials   Human Resource & E~ Roseland, New Jersey  
#> 10 AAP    Advance Auto~ Consumer Dis~ Automotive Retail   Raleigh, North Caroli~
#> # i 493 more rows
#> # i abbreviated name: 1: `Headquarters Location`
#> # i 3 more variables: `Date added` <chr>, CIK <int>, Founded <chr>

To try IMDB out I scraped the people that worked on âThe Dark Knightâ that are mentioned in the IMDB top 250 ratings page.

url  <- "https://www.imdb.com/chart/top/?ref_=nv_mv_250"
html <- url %>% 
  read_html()

people <- html %>% 
  html_nodes(".titleColumn > a") %>% 
  .[[3]] %>% 
  html_attr("title")
print(people)
#> [1] "Christopher Nolan (dir.), Christian Bale, Heath Ledger"

4 Functional Programming

Following the example i printed some numbers and retrieved the possible bike colors from the data file.

numbers <- c(1:3)
numbers_list <- map(numbers, print)
#> [1] 1
#> [1] 2
#> [1] 3
bike_data_lst <- fromJSON("../../src/bike_data.json")
print(bike_data_lst %>% purrr::pluck("productDetail", "variationAttributes", "values", 1, "displayValue"))
#> [1] "Stealth"     "aero silver"

5 CHALLENGE

Asking the API for the weather on Gran Canaria in this week.

# Task 1. Asking an API.
library(ggplot2)

weather_api <- function() {
  url <- modify_url(url = "https://api.open-meteo.com/v1/forecast?latitude=27.7564556&longitude=-15.5910148&current_weather=true&hourly=temperature_2m,relativehumidity_2m,windspeed_10m")
  resp <- GET(url)
  stop_for_status(resp) # automatically throws an error if a request did not succeed
}

weather <- weather_api() %>% content()

weather_tbl <- tibble(time = weather[["hourly"]][["time"]],temp = weather[["hourly"]][["temperature_2m"]])
weather_df <- weather_tbl %>% data.frame
print(weather_df) # Print weather as df
#>                 time temp
#> 1   2023-04-29T00:00 22.6
#> 2   2023-04-29T01:00 22.1

weather_df$time <- as.numeric(as.POSIXct(strptime(weather_df$time, "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M"))) # Convert time to numberic
weather_df$temp <- as.numeric(weather_df$temp) # Convert temp to numberic

ggplot(weather_df, aes(time, temp)) +
  geom_point() +
  scale_y_continuous(limits = c(-10, 40)) # Ploting weather
# Task 2. Looking at other bike shops.

# Radon-bikes mountainbike category
url <- "https://www.radon-bikes.de/e-bike/mountainbike/"

# Retrieve names from bikeTitle class
bike_names <- url %>% 
  read_html() %>% 
  html_nodes(".bikeTitle > h4") %>%
  html_text() 

# Retrieve prices from info class
bike_prices <- url %>% 
  read_html() %>% 
  html_nodes(".info > div > div > span") %>%
  html_text()
# Since there is a second price in pounds sterling we remove those and only look at the price in euros
bike_prices <- bike_prices[seq(1,length(bike_prices),2)]

# Transform into tibble and print
tibble(name = bike_names,price = bike_prices) %>% print()
#> # A tibble: 6 x 2
#>   name              price
#>   <chr>             <chr>
#> 1 RENDER AL         3999 
#> 2 RENDER            4999 
#> 3 DEFT              4799 
#> 4 JEALOUS HYBRID    2499 
#> 5 ZR TEAM HYBRID CX 1799 
#> 6 ZR LADY HYBRID CX 2499
# Since there are only 6 different bikes in the mountainbike category, only these are shown
